Including some amazing misunderstandings, like Bitcoin txs had IP addrs, or even names on them.
I've spoken to far too many reg types who incorrectly thought Bitcoin was _never_ anonymous.
More just that you can achieve anonymity in Bitcoin, but it's easy to screw up and fail.
It really bothers me how ppl tell law/reg/govt types that Bitcoin is never anonymous - that's very dishonest.
Yup. If you're a dark-market dealer, assume Bitcoin isn't anonymous; if you're a regulator, assume it can be.
Assuming that Bitcoin _isn't_ anonymous, _is_ one of those assumptions that you can't safely make.
In Bitcoin in the worst possible scenario, those nodes have to spend money to rewrite history; in PoS they can do so for free.
Content censorship has nothing to do with blockchains, Wikileaks existed before Bitcoin White Paper & still does w/out blockchain
